p: Without precise data on the total number of diagnosed cases and specific characteristics of the patients including age at diagnosis, comorbidities, clinical care, and treatment, it is difficult to pinpoint the true answer to this question. However, it appears that Germany applied what we could call a ‘combined strategy’, which involved conducting many tests at an early stage while instigating a full quarantine, and this may partly explain the low number of deaths compared with some other countries that only performed quarantine or testing but not at an early stage.
